p: We evaluated a range of climatic variables representing energy and moisture gradients that have been significantly associated with fire patterns in other studies e.g., [ 9, 13, 22, 38, 48– 49] ( Table 1). These included two temperature variables, annual minimum temperature and temperature seasonality; two moisture variables, annual and summer precipitation; and climatic water deficit (CWD), which is an integrative measure of climatic and edaphic factors that are indicative of drought stress [ 50– 51].
